items.q: What does 'allegro' mean in musical tempo markings?
items.explanation: Allegro typically refers to a brisk, uptempo pace, usually between 120 and 156 beats per minute.

items.q: The theremin is an instrument played without any physical contact.
items.explanation: The player manipulates electromagnetic fields between two antennas to control pitch and volume.

items.q: In sheet music, a sharp symbol (#) lowers a note by a half step.
items.explanation: A sharp raises a note by a half step. A flat (b) lowers it by a half step.

items.q: What constitutes a 'power trio' in rock music?
items.a: A power trio is a rock band format consisting of an electric guitar, an electric bass, and a drum kit, without a rhythm guitarist or keyboardist.
items.explanation: Famous power trios include Rush, Nirvana, and Cream.

items.q: Describe what 'harmony' means in vocal performance.
items.a: Harmony occurs when multiple pitches are sung simultaneously, creating chords that complement and support the main melody.
items.explanation: It adds depth and richness to the overall sound.

items.q: What is the purpose of an 'amp' (amplifier)?
items.a: An amplifier takes a weak electrical signal from an instrument (like an electric guitar) or vocal microphone and boosts it so it can drive speakers and be heard clearly.
items.explanation: Amplifiers can also shape the tone and distortion of electric instruments.

items.q: Which artist is known for the 1984 hit song 'Purple Rain'?
items.explanation: He also starred in the semi-autobiographical film of the same name.

items.a: An octave is the interval between one musical pitch and another with double or half its frequency.
items.explanation: Notes that are an octave apart sound 'the same' but in a higher or lower register.

items.q: What is a 'cadence' in classical composition?
items.a: A cadence is a series of chords that concludes a musical phrase, providing a sense of resolution or resting point.
items.explanation: It functions similarly to punctuation at the end of a sentence.

items.q: Name the genre that combines elements of rhythm and blues, gospel, and soul, heavily popularized by Motown Records.
items.explanation: Motown music had a distinct, polished pop appeal dubbed 'The Motown Sound'.
